text.__SUMMARY__: Campanula bravensis is a species of flowering plants of the Campanulaceae family. The species is endemic to Cape Verde. The specific name bravensis refers to the island of Brava. The species was described by Carl August Bolle, and named by Auguste Chevalier in 1935. Its local name is contra-bruxas-branca ("white against witches").
text.Distribution and ecology: Campanula jacobaea occurs in the islands of Santiago, Fogo and Brava.
text.External links: Auguste Chevalier (1935). Les îles du Cap Vert : géographie, biogéographie, agriculture. Flore de l'archipel, National Historic Natural Museum, Colonial Agronomy Laboratory, Paris
